medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced sore and cracked nipples within 24 hours after delivery, which progressed to bleeding. After 4 days, a bright red area developed on the breast, spreading to cover three quarters of the breast, accompanied by a lump near the nipple and fever (temperature of about 39Â°C). The pain increased although the patient continued to breastfeed. It was initially thought to be a blocked duct or mastitis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous miscarriage 2 years ago, lactose intolerance since childhood, and allergy to penicillin. Generally healthy otherwise.
medical_history.family_history: Father died young with emphysema, mother is well, and a great aunt had breast cancer. Patient was breastfed as an infant, as were her 2 siblings.
medical_history.social_history: Married, communication professional, lives in Boston, receives care from an obstetrician-gynecologist at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, and has commercial health insurance in a managed care plan.
